description.narrative: The proposed Project is increasing IFC's financing support to a previously approved investment (Ref: IFC/R2019-0209, June 19, 2019) with the purpose of enhancing SME lending. Given this, the development impact assessment of this project is the same as the earlier project, which received an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Excellent, based on an AIMM score of 68. On an unadjusted basis (i.e., without likelihood factor), the full potential AIMM score could reach 112. The most significant, expected Project-level outcomes are increased access to finance for SMEs in Uzbekistan. In addition, the Project will support the growth of Ipoteka's WSME portfolio, as the Bank commits to earmark 25 percent of IFC funding towards WSMEs. Beyond the Project, IFC investments will promote greater market competitiveness through market-enabling, competition and demonstration channels by contributing to the privatization of Uzbekistan's banking system. IFC interventions are key in building a more efficient, inclusive, and transparent banking sector - a critical enabling factor or transitioning to a market-oriented economy.

The proposed investment package to Ipoteka-Bank (Ipoteka or the Bank), a state-owned entity and an existing investment and advisory client in the Republic of Uzbekistan, consists of: (i) a 5-year senior loan of up to US$50 million equivalent in Uzbek Sum (UZS) (the Loan); and (ii) cross currency swaps to hedge a portion of the Bank's U.S. dollar (USD) and Euro denominated liabilities into UZS, with the aggregate notional amount of up to US$50 million equivalent, maximum maturity of up to 24 months and the overall loan equivalent value (LEQ), which is the expected positive average marked-to-market value of the proposed transactions, of up to US$1.5 million (the Project). The swap is not linked to the loan and constitutes a separate component of the Project.
